fields.description:
Currently, there's no option to add a ribbon notification on Jira Cloud, so that users get notified on assignments or due dates when they access a specific project.

It would be helpful to add a option to notify users directly on the UI without having to send them emails or use a third-party add-on
fields.summary: Ability to add ribbon notifications

fields.description:
h3. Summary
As a user of Jira's REST API, sometimes, the error message or return message is quite confusing when there are certain permissions used against the project.

It would be good if the error message or return message could be specific in the case when the issue is caused by a permission problem but the return message fails to state the actual problem and gives a generic message. For example, trying to update an issue field on an issue that is blocked due to security level. The API should state that "you do not have permission on this issue" rather than return a 200 okay response.
fields.summary: REST API error message or return message should be specific

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Print Preview does not show all pages for attachments (PDF)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open an issue
 # Add a PDF attachment(which has more than 4 pages, attached sample for reference)
 # Click on the Attachment to view it
 # Right-click and click print
 # Print preview shows only two pages 

h3. Expected Results

Print preview of an attachment (PDF) needs to show all pages
h3. Actual Results

Print preview of an attachment (PDF) does not show all pages and limit is set to 2

h3. Workaround
To print all pages, the file must be downloaded first.
fields.summary: Print Preview does not show all pages for attachments (PDF)

fields.description:
When creating JQL Filters that use a long and extensive query, for example "status in()", but with more than 50 statuses, it will break, returning the error:
{code}
Error occurred communicating with the server. Please reload the page and try again.
{code}

The error message that users see on their screen is as attached below:
 !Screenshot 2021-10-04 at 6.34.06 AM.png|thumbnail! 

Because of [JRACLOUD-71755 - Long JQL Queries Break the Search Returning Errors|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-71755] Bug, the users are seeing 400 Bad Request on their screens. So it would be nice if we make the error message more clear and user-friendly so that the users can shorten their JQL and perform the search successfully.
fields.summary: Make the error message clear when users are unable to search because of long JQL

fields.description: In the new issue view, work logs can be accidentally lost by simply clicking on the page background outside of the pop-up work log window.  To prevent losing important work logs, please either implement a work log auto save feature or prevent the work log window from disappearing when a user clicks away from the work log pop-up window in the foreground.  For the latter, the work log window should disappear only after clicking the "Cancel" button.
fields.summary: Prevent losing work logs (auto save, etc.)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
when you select Avg Time in Status gadget to use in dashboards, all the statuses from all workflows are returned, making impossible to use the gadget

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Dashboard
 # include the gadget "Avg Time in Status"
# Check the list of statuses 

h3. Expected Results
We should be able to filter the statuses or just load after including the project or the filter

h3. Actual Results
All statuses from all workflows are returned
 !image-2021-10-01-12-59-14-122.png|thumbnail! 



h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: in the gadget Avg Time in Status all the statuses are returned and we can't use the gadget due to that

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
There is a limitation in attachment numbers to 120 in the new issue view as per [New issue view fails to load attachments when there are more than 120 attachments|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-74515].

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Attach more than 150 attachments on an issue.
# Try to view the attachments on issue view.

h3. Expected Results
A warning message should be displayed when attaching the 121st or when reaching the 120th attachment that the attachment limit is 120 as per the documentation above.

h3. Actual Results
No warning is displayed and at some point, the attachments stop being displayed.

h3. Workaround
Use the old issue view is the workaround by now.
fields.summary: Display a warning when attachment limit is closer to be reached or is reached.

fields.description:
There are a bunch of little UX related things in JIRA that dont behave as expected and make JIRA feel clumsy.

 

Some of these are interference with standard keyboard actions. For example in a drop down selection has a text field so the user can start typing to filter out the available choices. This is fine and expected but once you type and dont find anything you cant hit Shift+Home to select what you typed and start typing replacement text. You have to hit the backspace key. 

 

Another example is also present in the same scenario, except instead of doing Shift+Home, I set the focus to another control on the page, or just somewhere else. The text that I typed disappears rather than stays. If I'm trying to get a screenshot of a value not available despite my typing it in correctly, I have a bad time.

 

Its not just the drop down lists, its also things like text area scrolling doesnt always scroll the correct panel, mislabeled context menu actions ("Remove from Sprint" does not actually remove from sprint), having a JIRA Query Language that does not apply to Queries, etc. These little things add up to JIRA feeling clumsy and unfinished.  

 

Also note the CAPITALIZATION of the word JIRA. I should not have to keep Ctrl+Z, arrow right, for any system to accept what I wrote, 

 

There is no component choice that matches UI, so I just picked one at random
fields.summary: Make the UX control interactions with JIRA behave like other programs

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement:

The Issue View doesn't render *.eml* or *.msg* files attach to Jira issues. 

{{eml}} files are rendered as text

{{msg}} files are rendered at code
h3. Suggested Solution:

E-mails should be rendered as they originally are (maybe render as HTML, per example).
h3. Why this is important

Both of these file extensions show a lot of low-value information to the user when viewing an issue.
fields.summary: Improve the rendering of email files on issue view

fields.description:
Currently Automation has an action to send email, and it supports email addresses, user/group fields, groups and smart values (which are expected to contain email addresses) but does not yet support project roles. 

This request is to add support for project roles in this automation action.
fields.summary: Add the ability to send email to all members of a project role using Automation

fields.description:
As of now, we can share filters with the below:
* *Project*: Shares the Filter with the users added in a particular project.
* *Group*: Shares the Filter with the users of a specific Group.
* *My Organisation*: Shares the Filter with all the Jira users on the site.
* *Public*: Makes the filter available to the internet.
* *Private*: Makes the filter only visible to you.

However, it would be great to have the ability to share the filters with a specific user from a particular domain, as we have under [Profile Visibility|https://support.atlassian.com/atlassian-account/docs/update-your-profile-and-visibility-settings/].
fields.summary: Share Filters only with certain users for a Domain

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating a child issue of an epic via the Jira rest api it is possible to trigger an intermittent, transient, internal server error that is misreported as an HTTP 400 bad request.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Attempt to create an issue that is the Child of an Epic via the Issue Create Rest API

h3. Expected Results

An HTTP 200 successful response, or a 500 if an internal server error was encountered.
h3. Actual Results

An HTTP 400 bad request is returned in the case of certain, transient server errors.
h3. Workaround


 Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available.

However a retry of the initial request that received a 400 may succeed in the case where it was a misreported server error.
fields.summary: Attempting to create an Issue via the Rest API can return 400 Bad Request on internal error

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, we have Linked pages section for Company managed projects in the Sprint report and would like to have to the same feature for Team-Managed project as well.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to *Sprint report* on Team-Managed project.
 # There is not option for "*View Linked pages*" unlike Company managed project.

h3. Expected Results

View Linked pages to be available for Team-managed project as well
h3. Actual Results

Currently this feature is not available in Team-Managed projects.
h3. Workaround

Would have to use the option "*Project Pages*" Under the Team-Managed Project Menu.
fields.summary: Linked pages option in Sprint report for Team-Managed projects

fields.description:
When opening the date picker on any screen to set the dates, and then rapidly clicking through the "move next month" buttons, the width changes, so sometimes the button to move to the NEXT YEAR appears under the cursor while clicking, and it's very easy to overlook that instead of selecting the next month, you've selected the next YEAR.

Keep the calendar date picker the same width regardless of the month name length.
fields.summary: Date picker keep resizing while going through each month

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When trying to delete a custom field option, it takes more than a minute and it doesn't work. After some minutes, it returns this page:

 !screenshot-5.png|thumbnail! 


This can happen depending on the number of issues related to that option custom field (we tested with 40k issues with the value).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Edit Options for Custom Field and try to delete an option. For example:

 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail!  

h3. Expected Results
It should ask for the confirmation for the deletion of that option custom field. 
Also, it should show all the issues related to that option, as below:

 !screenshot-4.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
The page returns a "Page unavailable" error and the option custom field is never deleted.


h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Error 500 when trying to delete a custom field option

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When the ticket is resolved with a resolution, these issues should have their keys -strikethrough-. However, in the _Activity Stream gadget_, the issue key is not -strikethrough-.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Dashboard > Add the Activity Stream gadget
 # Then, access a ticket and resolve it
 # Access the dashboard and verify the update made on the ticket

h3. Expected Results

According to [this document|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloudkb/best-practices-on-using-the-resolution-field-968660796.html], the issue should have its key strikethrough:
 !Expected results.png|width=488,height=211!
h3. Actual Results

The issue key is not strikethrough:
 !Actual Results.png|width=603,height=129!
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Closed issues no longer have their keys strikethrough in the Activity Stream gadget

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement

Currently, project description is not show nowhere but in Project Settings > Details.
h3. Expected Results

It would be good to be able to consult this information also in project browser (https://<site>.atlassian.net/jira/projects), by adding a new column into it:

!image-2021-09-30-14-19-56-548.png|width=601,height=173!
h3. Actual Results

At this moment, it's only possible to check project's description by accessing Project Settings > Details in each project. No even through Advanced Search this information is available since project description is not a field in Jira.
fields.summary: Possibility to add Project Description to columns in project browser

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Browsing apps in Jira Marketplace do not show the name of the selected add-on in the browser tab.
Currently, it shows 'Find new apps - Jira' instead of the app name.
!Screen Shot 2021-09-30 at 15.37.45.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Jira instance *Apps*.
 # Click *Find new apps*.
 # Open an app in a new browser tab.

h3. Expected Results
The name of the tabs should include the name of the open Marketplace app.

h3. Actual Results
All browser tabs have the same name 'Find new apps - Jira'.

h3. Why is it important
If a user is comparing apps or browsing multiple apps at the same time it is hard to navigate not knowing what tab belongs to what app was opened.
fields.summary: Browser tab naming according to the opened addon name on Jira Marketplace

fields.description:
Currently we only support following types of custom fields :
 * checkbox
 * date picker
 * user picker (single user)
 * number
 * radio button
 * label
 * single-choice select
 * multiple-choice select
 * single-line text
 * URL (read-only)

While integrating Insight Asset Mangement, it offers different types of custom fields which are not yet supported by Advanced Roadmaps

These fields are greyed out when selecting them into the plan
fields.summary: Support for the Insight Custom fields

fields.description:
When an user sends access request to a site, Site admins have ability to either *Approve* *now* or *Deny request.*
 * Once the site admin Clicks on Approve now, the user gets access to the site, and if Clicks on *Deny request,* the user wouldn't be able to make an access request again to the site and receives the below notifications.
 !image-2021-09-30-16-43-23-916.png!

There are scenarios where the site admin has accidentally *Deny Request,* therefore there should be an option to undo the action or the ability to unblock the user so that the user could send future access requests. Deny Request.

*Workaround*:

Currently, admin has to manually invite these users whose requests were denied once.
fields.summary: Ability to unblock access request filter

fields.description:
As of now, users don't get the *Linked issues* field while creating issues from *Jira for Outlook plugin*.

It would be quite helpful if this field can be included to be present while issue creation from Outlook.
fields.summary: Ability to Link issues field while creating issues from Jira for Outlook plugin

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

For Android App:

If you use default value for a multiline text field, this value won't appear when creating issue.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open the android App.
 # Tap on create issue button.
 # And choose your project which has multiline text field that uses default value

h3. Expected Results

The create issue dialog will show the default value for the multiline text field
h3. Actual Results

The create issue dialog show empty value for the multiline text field
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Leave the field empty and modify it later after issue created.
fields.summary: Create issue on Android app not showing default value for multiline text field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After attaching an mp4 video file and reloading the page file preview shows the file as an audio file. Opening the mp4 video in the new issue view only plays the audio.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Initially, once the mp4 video is attached in the New issue view it has a video preview and it can be played without any issues, video, and audio.
 # Once you refresh the Chrome and Firefox browser, the new issue view preview of the attachment breaks. When you click to play the video only audio is played.
 # Video recording attached on how to replicate.
 [^Screen Recording 2021-09-24 at 13.52.49 (4).mov]

h3. Expected Results

The new issue view preview of the attached mp4 file should show the video and play both audio and video when opened on.
h3. Actual Results

The new issue view preview of the attachment is not available, once opened in the new issue view only audio is played.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: File Previewer doesn't play mp4 files properly. Only audio stream plays.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When issues are moved between team and company projects and there exists an epic with child issues in it, this Epic relationship is completely lost in the course of moving these issues into a company managed project.  See JSWCLOUD-17221 for a context of history on this issue.

While JSWCLOUD-18643 sought to maintain this relationship, instead the resolution in that ticket indicates that a warning banner is now provided when users try to move a single issue of type Epic in a team managed project.

Unfortunately, the Bulk operations are not also displaying this warning during the move.  Which results in customers moving these issues and losing that epic/child relation data on their issues


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a team managed project with an Epic
# Assign some issues to that Epic
# Using the bulk operations, move multiple issues in that project including the epic to a Company managed project

h3. Expected Results
We expect to see the same kind of warning we see when moving an epic to a different project.
 !movesingleepic.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
No such warning appears.
 !bulkmovenowarnsad.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
none
fields.summary: Using bulk operations to move issues between team and company projects does not warn users of data loss regarding Epic relations

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While performing a JQL search using the *text ~* operator the performance is severely impacted by amount of projects and custom fields available.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # While having access to a single project in an instance loaded with data and several fields perform a *text ~* search
 # In the same instance while having access to all projects and issues perform the same query

h3. Expected Results

The *text ~* searchshould take a similar amount of time between the two searches
h3. Actual Results

The search where the user has less access is faster
h3. Workaround

Use labels for issues and searches or filter by a single text field such as summary.
fields.summary: Performing a JQL search using "text ~" is severely impacted by projects and custom fields available

fields.description:
Just like Bitbucket uses headers that can identify which webhooks were triggered: [https://support.atlassian.com/bitbucket-cloud/docs/event-payloads/]

For tracing in Jira, there is no method of identifying which webhook was used. Therefore, a developer suggested this feature request, that a UUID in the headers could verify which webhooks were used.
fields.summary: Add UUID of webhook in the headers

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you try using the [+API key+|https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/jPnJOQ] used to manage your organization via the [admin APIs|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/rest-apis/] to authenticate REST API calls against Jira Cloud REST API, you get below error message in return:
{quote}Basic authentication with passwords is deprecated. For more information, see: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/deprecation-of-basic-authentication-with-passwords-for-jira-and-confluence-apis-972355348.html]
{quote}
Having a bit more generic/useful error message would be better.

Something like:
{quote}Authentication failed. Make sure you are using the email address and API Token (not API Key) to authenticate. For more details see: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/deprecation-of-basic-authentication-with-passwords-for-jira-and-confluence-apis-972355348.html]
{quote}
 

Also, the link returned should explicitly mention the differences between [+API key+|https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/jPnJOQ] and [API Token|https://support.atlassian.com/atlassian-account/docs/manage-api-tokens-for-your-atlassian-account/].

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Try to authenticate any REST API call using an [+API key+|https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/jPnJOQ] instead of an [API Token|https://support.atlassian.com/atlassian-account/docs/manage-api-tokens-for-your-atlassian-account/] 

h3. Expected Results

An generic error message saying the authentication failed is returned 
h3. Actual Results

A very specific error message about basic authentication with password being deprecated is returned:
{quote}Basic authentication with passwords is deprecated. For more information, see: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/deprecation-of-basic-authentication-with-passwords-for-jira-and-confluence-apis-972355348.html]
{quote}
h3. Workaround

No workaround.
fields.summary: Misleading error message when authenticating REST API calls with API Key instead of API Token

fields.description:
When number fields are displayed in Jira, and these values exceed 3 digits, there is a convention to use a separator in order to show the difference between thousands, millions, billions, etc. and to represent decimal digits.

Different languages have different languages to represent the decimals and thousands,million etc.The only way to control this is to change your language settings and have your language/region settings adjust this on your behalf. 

Examples:
||Language||appearance||
|English|5,432|
|Russian|5 432|
|Español|5.432|

When you select some language that uses commas to separate thousands and try to enter a number in a number field, you only get the option to use .(dot) to separate decimals.

I would be great if Jira could accept number which include dots to separate thousands and comma to indicate decimals.
fields.summary: Allow number field to accept dots to separate thousands and comma to indicate decimals

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Translation issue on the french version.
 When using the time tracker, the pop-up shows two closing buttons: "Save" and "Cancel".
 On the french translation, "Cancel" should be translated as "Annuler" but is instead translated as "Annulé" (the equivalent of "Canceled").
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add the time tracker field to the field configuration and the issue screen
 # Create an issue and update the time tracking field.
 # "Cancel" should be translated as "Annuler" but is instead translated as "Annulé"

h3. Expected Results

Cancel should be translated as "Annuler"
h3. Actual Results

Cancel is translated as "Annulé"
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Translation error on the french version when using Time Tracking Field.

fields.description:
Under the *Recent rule executions* panel, if a rule performs no action then it is correctly logged. However, the difference between a "Successful" execution and "No actions performed" is very minute.

Going by the icons, both are green. "Successful" execution shows a checkmark and "No actions performed" shows a hyphen but both in green.
 !Screenshot 2021-09-29 at 12.01.18.png!

This is confusing some users as the green mostly denotes that the automation rule ran successfully. Hovering on the icon shows the action performed but it is an additional step all the time. The suggestion here is to change the colour of the icon when "No actions performed" by the rule.
fields.summary: Change the colour of the icon for "No actions performed" under the automation field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Previewing some pdf documents in Jira causes the file to display boxes instead of actual text.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Upload the attached file to a Jira issue
 # Click thumbnail to see the preview

h3. Expected Results
The preview is shown

h3. Actual Results
No characters are shown.

h3. Workaround
Download the file.
fields.summary: No characters are shown in PDF preview when using certain files

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

With a description that only has an image as its body, viewing the issue within the mobile view shrinks and the description sometimes cannot be seen. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue
 # Add an image in the description (no text)
 # Open the issue in the mobile view

h3. Expected Results

The issue view should not shrink the description and the image should be viewable.
h3. Actual Results

The issue view shrinks the image in the description so it cannot be seen.
h3. Workaround

View the issue on desktop or mobile app.
fields.summary: Issue view descriptions with images shrink on Mobile views

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
On the *Filter Counts* dashboard gadget, on building a custom count, it's not possible to 'Switch to basic' search even when there's no JQL entered

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a Filter Count to your dashboard
 # Set it to any filter or project
 # Build a custom count
 # On the criteria field, try to 'Switch to basic' search

h3. Expected Results
It should be possible to switch to basic search for the criteria if there's no JQL query entered.

h3. Actual Results

'Switch to basic' option is greyed out even when there's no JQL query entered
 !image-2021-09-29-11-47-24-108.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Use the 'Advanced' JQL query to build the custom count for the gadget
fields.summary: Filter counts Dashboard Gadget does not allow 'Switch to basic' for the criteria

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira Automation is not allowing to set different due dates for different create issue actions in the same automation rule
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a rule with more than one create issue action
 # Try to set different smart values for the due date field from the different issues
 # All create issue actions show the same due date

h3. Expected Results

Each create issue action should allow to set a different smart value for the due date
h3. Actual Results

All create actions have the same due date

video attached

h3. Workaround

Set the due date using the Additional fields section
fields.summary: Jira Automation is not allowing to set different due dates for different create issue actions in the same automation rule

fields.description: It's currently possible to click on a linked issue number to open it in a new tab, but not possible to right-click on the issue summary in order to open it. It would be helpful to add this option for improved usability.
fields.summary: Right-click on Issue Summary to open linked issues in a new tab

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Side view from board columns doesn't update the status if the issue is transitioned from the board columns
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # configure you board to display issues on the side view
 # transition one issue to another status
 # Issue on the side view still shows the old status.

h3. Expected Results

Issue will show the updated information
h3. Actual Results

Issue stills shows old info

Video attached
h3. Workaround

Use *Open issues in dialog* option
fields.summary: Side view from board columns doesn't update the status if the issue is transitioned from the board columns

fields.description:
h4. Use case scenario
In team-managed projects, the board admin is automatically assigned to the user who created the project. 
If the user left the company or if the user's account was deleted, the board list view will show the board's admin as  "former user". And there is no option given to change the board's admin. 
Of course, this doesn't prevent other admins to modify the board settings. However, it could create confusion when determining who's the owner of the board. 

h4. Expected behavior
Provide an option to change the board's admin either in the Boards list view or in the board settings.

h4. Actual result
No option is available to change the current board's admin.
fields.summary: Ability to change Board's Admin in Team-Managed Projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On Issue creation, when setting a Date Picker field, if the user's profile language is set to French/Italian, the date filled when the user clicks on the calendar icon and picks a day is filled with an invalid format.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Log into an instance and change the default language to French.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Jira Cloud API Audit record ({{GET /rest/api/3/auditing/record}}) is returning Jira usernames instead of Atlassian Account Ids making it harder for administrators to see who made an action.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make a request to get audit records from Jira using the [GET /rest/api/3/auditing/record|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-audit-records/#api-rest-api-3-auditing-record-get] REST API endpoint
 # See the response

h3. Expected Results
The response returned allows you to identify (complying with GDPR guidelines) the user who made the action that was logged.

h3. Actual Results
The returned results identifies the user by their Jira username which does not follow the standards described here: [https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/deprecation-notice-user-privacy-api-migration-guide/]

Example
{code}
{
    "offset": 0,
    "limit": 1,
    "total": 25050,
    "records": [
        {
            "id": 36102,
            "summary": "User removed from group",
            "created": "2021-09-20T17:05:39.265+0000",
            "category": "group management",
            "eventSource": "",
            "objectItem": {
                "name": "My Group A",
                "typeName": "GROUP",
                "parentId": "10000",
                "parentName": "com.atlassian.crowd.directory.IdentityPlatformRemoteDirectory"
            },
            "associatedItems": [
                {
                    "id": "ug:2de9168b-e72d-439e-8719-e3748295712f",
                    "name": "ug:2de9168b-e72d-439e-8719-e3748295712f",
                    "typeName": "USER",
                    "parentId": "10000",
                    "parentName": "IDP Directory"
                }
            ]
        }
    ]
}
{code}

Highlighting the portion
{code}
...
"id": "ug:2de9168b-e72d-439e-8719-e3748295712f",
"name": "ug:2de9168b-e72d-439e-8719-e3748295712f"
...
{code}

h3. Workaround
It is possible to use the [GET /rest/api/3/user/bulk/migration|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-users/#api-rest-api-3-user-bulk-migration-get] REST API endpoint to translate usernames and keys to Atlassian account Ids.
fields.summary: Jira Cloud API Audit record is returning Jira usernames instead of Atlassian Account Ids

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If your Jira instance has too many results to be retrieved including number of issues and the number of entries on their history, the *Average time in status* gadget will fail to load the result: *Oops - an error has occurred*
 !Screen Shot 2021-09-27 at 11.33.48.png|thumbnail!

That's due to how the gadget currently build the query to retrieve those results from the database, where it will JOIN different tables.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * On the scenario I worked on, the Jira instance had the following approximate metrics:
 ** Number of issues: *1 million*
 ** Number of entries on the history (total): *100 million*

h3. Expected Results

The gadget will load and display the results.
h3. Actual Results

The gadget will fail to load and display an error instead.
h3. Workaround

Reducing the number of days on the gadget's configuration might work, but there isn't a defined value as that depends on each scenario:
 !Screen Shot 2021-09-27 at 11.32.49.png|thumbnail!

Another possible workaround is to use this free third-party app: [Time in Status Reports|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1226187/time-in-status-reports?hosting=cloud&tab=overview]:
 * It provides an *Average time in status report*
 !Screen Shot 2021-09-27 at 11.22.56.png|thumbnail!
 * The app was able to retrieve results on the Jira instance I worked with when reporting this bug
 ** The app retrieves results via REST API. The logic behind the database query Jira performs when retrieving those results is better for this scenario
fields.summary: Average time in status gadget shows error with significant issue histories

h3. Issue Summary

Clicking issue key link in description field after it's moved to other project cause browser to freeze. It only affects if the issue key was added in old issue view.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Edit the description and add its own issue key (ie. ABC-123) in it > Save
# Move the ticket to other project (this will change the issue key, for example DEF-234)
# Open the same issue in new issue view and click the issue link as per in the description
#* The link has additional value to something like: https://URL.atlassian.net/ABC-123#icft=ABC-123


h3. Expected Results

* It should open the same issue without any issue

h3. Actual Results

The browser freeze and unusable

h3. Workaround

Edit the description from the new issue view > Save > re-add the same issue key

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If someone accidentally hits the "Cancel" button during a filling of an Issue, immediately the comment is gone with no confirmation. A dialog box before committing the cancelation, for example, "Are you sure you want to cancel your comment?" would help avoid losing it.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
h3. 1. Create an issue
2. Begin creating a comment
3. Click Cancel 
h3. Expected Results

A dialog box to confirm the cancelation of the comment during a filling of an Issue.
h3. Actual Results

The text filled into the Issue is removed without a confirmation.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior inside Jira. At your own risk, it's possible to use a Third-Part Addon for caching texts on the web browser.
fields.summary: Confirmation of the cancel event before it has been committed when creating comment.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a new user tries to bulk edit child issues, if they click on *Choose issues*, they are redirected to the parent issue, instead of to the page where they can select which issues to update.

Once the user clicks on *View in search*, instead of *Bulk edit*, Jira apparently stops doing the redirection and acts correctly.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to any issue with child issues with a new user to the site;
 # In the *three dots* beside the subtasks, select *Bulk Edit*;
 # In the *Bulk Operations* page, click on *Choose Issues*.

!image-2021-09-17-13-56-49-384.png|width=196,height=88!   >   !image-2021-09-17-13-58-36-536.png|width=253,height=112!
h3. Expected Results

The system should show a screen with the issues to be selected:

!image-2021-09-17-13-59-42-552.png|width=175,height=118!
h3. Actual Results

The system redirects to the parent screen.
h3. Workaround

If in step 2, the user clicks to *View in search* instead of *Bulk edit*, the next time they try to Bulk edit, the correct screen will be shown.

Another workaround would be to click to *View in search* and then click on the three dots to *Bulk change* the issues from the search screen.
fields.summary: Choose issues while bulk editing 'child issues' is not possible for 'new users'

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In a transition screen, whenever you have 2 required fields (requirement stablished by a transition validator), being one of them a multi-user picker field, whenever the user sets 2 values for the multi-user picker field and then try to transition the issue without setting a value for the other required field, Jira erases one of the previously set value on the multi-user picker field.
h3. Expected Results

No values should be cleared.
h3. Actual Results

Values previously set to the multi-user picker field are cleared.
h3. Other Notes

This problem only happens in Chrome 93.0.4577.63, so this is a browser specific issue.
h3. Workaround

Use another version of Chrome or a different browser.
fields.summary: Required multi-user picker fields are cleared if user tries to transition the screen without setting value of another required field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Users removed from an instance who still have an Atlassian Account are brought in the [/rest/api/2/users/search|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v2/api-group-users/#api-rest-api-2-users-search-get] API endpoint.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a user to a Jira instance and create a new issue with that user
 # Completely remove the user from the instance in the User Management
 # Use the [/rest/api/2/users/search|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v2/api-group-users/#api-rest-api-2-users-search-get] API endpoint to get all users of the instance

h3. Expected Results
Only current users of the instance should be returned.
h3. Actual Results
Current user and former users with an Atlassian Account are returned.
h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior.
fields.summary: Using the /users/search API returns former users who still have an Atlassian Account

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Issue picker in the Move Sub-Task page shows the search results incorrectly
h3. Steps to Reproduce

 
 * View the *Sub-Task*.
 * Select *Move* from More options.
 * Select *Change Parent*.
 * Enter the *Project key*. It should display all the parent issues that can be selected. But it doesn't the matching issues.

[!_thumb_6440722.png|thumbnail!|https://getsupport.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/6440722/6440722_Screenshot+2021-09-06+at+17.18.09.png]
h3. Expected Results

When we enter the project key, it should display all the parent issues that can be selected. But it doesn't the matching issues.
h3. Actual Results

The search results doesn't show all the matching issues where it shows only a few issues. 
h3. Workaround
 * Create an *Advanced Search filter* that fetches all the parent issues to which the *sub-task* can be assigned.
 * *Run* the search filter.
 * Perform the search on the *Move Sub-Task* page.
fields.summary: Issue picker in the Move Sub-Task page shows the search results incorrectly

fields.description:
*Problem Statement*

While is available to filter only Epics which are not Done yet when you're setting the Epic Link through issue view of a Story/Task/Bug, it's not possible to block "Create issue in epic" button to be available in done Epics.

Even if you set a non-editable property in a specific status for Epics, a user is able to add issues within it since this is not considered a edition in the Epic directly.

*Expected Results*

It should be possible to block done Epics to have issues included (Story/Task) through Epic issue view. 

*Workaround*

Currently, there is no workaround for that.
fields.summary: "Create issue in epic" button should not be available for Epics which are in Done status

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Jira search has a bug when you click view all results is selecting the status "In Progess" by default instead of "In Progress""
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to any instance
 # Use search Jira on the top right
 # Search for any word
 # Check "Open" option in "Filter by status"
 # Scroll down and select "View all results"

h3. Expected Results

The default query should include the status "In Progress" instead of "In Progess"
h3. Actual Results

You receive the following error:

The value 'In Progess' does not exist for the field 'statusCategory'.
h3. Workaround

You will need to fix the typo in the In Progess word and change it to "In Progress"
fields.summary: The Jira search has a bug when you click view all results is selecting the status "In Progess" by default instead of   "In Progress""

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The arrow to back under "Shared filters" of Global settings is truncated
h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Go to Global settings -> shared filters.
 # You'll see the list of shared filters, click on the forward arrow to go to the next page of filters.
 # While trying to come back to the previous page, the back arrow is truncated.

h3. Expected Results

The back arrow should be shown.
h3. Actual Results

No back arrow is shown instead there is a comma sign (,)
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

As a workaround click on the comma (,)symbol and it still works as a back arrow.
fields.summary: Back Arrow under Shared filter of Global settings is truncate

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using an add-on such as JQL Search Extensions which is capable of performing multiple requests of filter updates at the same time to a single filter, this causes a race condition that ultimately removes the filter shares, causing it to go private.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install JQL Search Extensions and have it continuously update one of its created filters that's shared with the organization

h3. Expected Results

The filter in Jira should be updated from the add-on via REST API that only changes the query.

h3. Actual Results

A race condition is created and Jira doesn't know how to handle this so it removes any filter shares saved, giving the impression that the add-on is updating the filter share to private.

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Simultaneous filter updates causes race condition and removes filter shares
